intro: Psoralea pustulata, commonly known as the blister psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. Its seed pods are typically inflated and contain several small, brown seeds. Psoralea pustulata is often found in open, sandy or rocky habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions.
